meanings.definition: To fill with love or delight
meanings.sent1: The puppy enamors the children with its playful antics.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful sunset enamors everyone who sees it.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies enamors the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song enamors the listener, wrapping them in its sweet embrace.
meanings.sent5: The colorful garden enamors visitors, painting a picture of joy and beauty.

meanings.sent1: Her enchanting smile enamors everyone she meets.
meanings.sent2: The magician's tricks never fail to enamor the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten enamors its owner with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The old bookshop enamors book lovers, drawing them in with its cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling diamond necklace enamors onlookers, capturing their attention with its brilliance.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel love or attraction
meanings.sent1: His kind gestures enamor his partner more and more each day.
meanings.sent2: The romantic movie never fails to enamor viewers with its touching storyline.
meanings.sent3: The charming prince enamors the princess with his gallant deeds.
meanings.sent4: The sweet scent of roses enamors her, reminding her of love's gentle embrace.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt letter enamors the recipient, filling their heart with warmth and affection.
